subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... Well... in most GUI JUnit runners (like the ones inside IDEs), you can just click on the failing test and re-run it directly. This is possible because
messageBody:
On 10/18/05, Jeff Grigg <jeffgrigg@...> wrote:
> Yes, I think that every test needs a meaningful name. Technically,
> a "moniker." Given the name/moniker of a failing test, it should be
> possible to automatically recreate and rerun just that test. That is,
> from "testThis(3 of 10)" or "testThis(5,'hello',true)", it should be
> possible to construct and run a test instance equivalent to the
> original. (And I'm saying "should" in the sense of, "The tool would
> be most useful if it did things this way.")

Well... in most GUI JUnit runners (like the ones inside IDEs), you can
just click on the failing test and re-run it directly. This is
possible because JUnit uses seperate instances per test (mild dig at
Cedric) - as such, a moniker isn't strictly necessary (though it
wouldn't hurt).

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
